values:
You're asking me will my love grow, 
I don't know, I don't know. 
Stick around, and it may show, 
But I don't know, I don't know. 

... 
this song always makes me smile :)

Another happy happy day :)

Ugh, my back still aches from PE lesson! I was pushed to do sit-ups by my really strong PE teacher. Ahahahaha okay, I know I sound kind of stupid, but I'm just not flexible at all! So my back really aches because of that :(

Made almost 100 dumplings with Mom about an hour ago, for my relatives. Skipping early chinese new year gathering with relatives, so only my mom and my sister are there right now, while I'm at home! :D

I mean, who has chinese new year gatherings this early? :/ And I'm having 2 math tests tomorrow, I needa study. Ha ha. Hmm, but I'm still kind of worried I might have offended them by not going, but ... well ... :/

Sock bunnies!

Ugh, sorry, I was bored. Really hot weather over here :(

I wanna buy Star Trek & UP!
And the Sherlock Holmes DVD too, when it's out.
Hmph. I do have the money, but I'm waiting for the price to drop, at least a little. Hehehe.
Ahhhh, I miss star trek, I wanna watch it again! :D Although I've watched it twice, and it was consecutively on the next day... It's too awesome!
Mwahahahahah.

Feeling really hungry. My mom's still cooking and it's already 6.40pm. Urrgghhhh. We're going to have steamboat for dinner, though, which makes me really happy :) 

School today was fun, as usual. Ahhhh, I'm so glad I got into class 3-4. Still, I am NEVER glad that I was not able to take Literature, NO NO NO. I still want to take Lit so super badly :( 

Can't wait for Mister Edgerton to come back to school! He says he'll be back on February 3 and he'll stay for 2 weeks :) Awesome, huh? I'm going to ask him if there's any chance he could get me my EOY exam's english essay back for me... Hehehe, I'm kinda embarrassed to ask anyone, but Mister Edgerton's the only teacher who'd understand why :) 

Realised I haven't typed in my LJ and my tumblr for so long, so here I am, updating both of them. 

By the way - I AM SO EXCITED TO SEE THE FRAY! 

Ahhh, the boys are going to make my day AWESOME :) I wonder if they'll play any new songs .... :D HOPEFULLY THEY WILL! 

Just remembered I need to buy a birthday gift for my editorial senior, Janet, on Friday. Ahhhh, I can't wait for friday :) Have to think of a gift soon, though. HMMM.... 

Well, this is still really pathetic because, as you can clearly see, I still can't figure out the 'fake cut' thingy of LJ. That's sorta like the most important and basic thing, but LJ doesn't exactly teach you ... I think. Urrrgghh, my LJ posts look stooooopid, don't they? 

Ha ha ha ha, all right, I'm gonna end this now :)

Back home from day of shopping. Went to the new mall at Somerset - 313. 
All the stuff I bought - Yellow sweater, purple stockings and Eternal Sunshine of the Spotless Mind DVD. 
Wore my black boots today for the first time! Expensive but comfy :) 
I was disappointed to see that HMV still didn't have The Fray Deluxe Album! Furious at store and wanted to bang the cashier counter for an explanation, but held back because I was afraid they wouldn't let me buy Eternal Sunshine of the Spotless Mind if I do that. 
Right-o. San Francisco in 4 days! I'm counting down :) 
Finally read that boring chinese book finish last night, so I can start on my book review tomorrow, and I wouldn't need to worry about it when I'm there or when I'm back. I'm organized, I know :) 

----------------- 

We live in a culture that prohibits individuality, and for that we have become not our parents, but our parents' parents. 
- @johncmayer

So, this officially sucks. 
I always told people that I think I'd get the literature combination for next year, mainly because "not many people might want it". What I meant then was that few people like and want literature, so there'll be vacancy for me next year. Little did I know that all BECAUSE of the really, really, really, REALLY, few people who chose literature in their combination, I did NOT get the combination. 
I don't get to take literature next year, and that's the same for the rest of the few EIGHT people who wanted literature. 
My school is not offering literature. 
My bloody hell stupid school is not offering literature to the whole grade of secondary threes next year!!! 

Gosh, I've never hated my school more than this. 
What would other schools say? "Jurong doesn't have literature? That's shameful, they must not have any literature-ish people at all." 
What would my seniors and those graduated people from my school say? "My gosh, this batch of people has no creative people." 
Okay, maybe not liking or wanting to take literature does not mean not creative, but literature is IMPORTANT and the fact that so few people in my batch want it, shows that my school doesn't have many people who believe that literature is important. It's like a symbol, showing that culture exists. My school doesn't have any bloody culture. 
Still, I think 8 people is alright, if there are people at all, 8 people is great. Why can't they just teach us 8 people?? 
Mister Chen says there aren't enough literature teachers to teach us. 
More like not enough literature teachers willing to teach us. 
Don't the teachers want us to study literature? It shows that we are interested in culture and the beauty of literary works! 
Urrgghh. 
I don't know what I'm going to do. 
My current combination for next year: 
English, Additional Maths, Elementary Maths, Chinese, Pure Chemistry, Pure Physics, Elective Geography, and Core History. 
What if I can't take Literature in Junior College? 
If that happens, I'll bang on the school gates demanding to see the Jurong principal and just shout at how my dreams and chances at pursuing literature are ruined, all because of them. 
I sound exaggerating, yeah, but that's because I'm so angry at them! 
My sister says some of her friends didn't take Literature in secondary school but are able to take it in JC, so that sounds promising... 
But. What if it's really hard to cope? If I don't learn it next year and the year after that, it might be hard for me in JC. JC is already much harder than secondary school, so I'm not sure I might be able to take it if I don't continue learning it where I am right now. 

I should have never came to Jurong. 
I've been playing The Fray's songs on repeat. They're serving as some sort of remedy for my... I don't think it counts as depression. Or a simple "sadness". So probably it's my frustration. Yeah, frustration sounds right. 
I watched the How To Save A Life's DVD video once more, and it does work. I'm feeling so much better now. 
I'm not focusing on how angry I am at my school, principal and teachers, and also how angry I am at them for spoiling my chances... 
My mom wants to enroll me in those courses where I can learn literature outside, but really, I don't think there are much out there. I want to be learning what the rest of the secondary schools are learning and take the O-Levels. Do many outside-school courses offer that?? 
The answer to that is: doubtful. 

.............. 
Let's talk about something else other than that... Mister Edgerton sent me a facebook message, thanking me for that picture frame I made for him. Ha ha, made me really happy about that. Until I scanned the message and saw where he said that my writing has improved throughout the period when he taught me. He said he knows I'll continue to improve next year and told me good luck. 
Those words made me go :( 
No one has ever really encouraged me so much about my writing than Mister Edgerton. 
My classmates all just tease and make fun of me, about how I do great for an essay/composition. They just say, "It's xueting, what do you expect??", or "What? Her again??", or saying on Facebook that I'd publish an amazing essay when asked what I'd do with a million dollars (Wei yuan), and that isn't complimenting. It sounds as though they're saying it... sarcastically. What, is it so bad to have a love for writing and literature? 
Today when Mister Chen announced that literature is dropped, jiaxin, vyshnavi, shirley, vanessa, chingwen, calvin and jia wei all went throwing looks in my direction. Calvin said, "Xueting, don't be sad already!" and Jia Wei was laughing (LAUGHING, can you believe it?!) and said, "Xueting, you crying, huh?" 
It was so hard trying to contain all that anger, frustration and sadness altogether so that they won't see and make fun of it. 

Okay I know I'm sticking to this stupid subject for so long... sorry. 
Still repeating The Fray songs all the way. They're making this so much better for me, I LOVE THE BOYS.

Hoping that this won't be as bad as I think it will be :/

"...let it be, 
you can't make it come or go... 
but you are gone, 
not for good but for now, 
and gone for now... 
feels a lot like gone for good..."

I can't believe my secondary two year is coming to an end!
Tomorrow is the last day of school!
We're gonna have a barbeque after school to celebrate, and also spend our last day with Mister Edgerton and the class (and Mister Chen, of course...).
Honestly, I'm not exactly sad to leave everyone in my class, because we'll all be separated into different classes next year and all...
Of course I'd miss most of the people, but I'll still be able to see them almost everyday and I can always make new friends.
I'm extremely sad about Mister Edgerton leaving in November and tomorrow being most, most, MOST likely the LAST day I'll see him. Last day to see him until January when he promises to come back to visit.
Mister Edgerton's a great teacher and very cool person and he's taught me for almost two years now, so it's really sad to see him leave.
I was so hoping he'd become a permanent teacher in Jurong, so even though he might not be teaching me next year and all, I can still see him in school and talk to him! He may even teach me english next year! ....
But obviously it's not possible for him to be a permanent teacher in Jurong... He's travelling over to Cambodia and Vietnam... and then back to the States, as he said. Awww. It's just so sad because I know I'm going to miss him so, so, soooo much next year.
He told me San Francisco is his favourite state in US and now I'm getting even more excited!
He told me San Fran's art galleries are fantastic so now I'm even more anticipating to visit those two museums I've already planned out to visit there: the Legion of Honor; and de Young Museum.
Mister Edgerton's got me even more excited for the trip!!
Ha ha ha. I'm really going to miss Mister Edgerton so much.

- - - - - - - - - - - -

As it is halloween soon anyway, it happens that my livejournal has risen from the dead!!
Either as a:
- zombie, or
- ghost, or
- monster, or
- itself,
It is BACK!
I must say, my blog is too boring and I love the livejournal style. Always have, always will.
So, will get new layout!
Will post new and more things about my life!
Hopefully my life would get more interesting so I can post more about it, in a more interesting way.
Ha ha ha, I feel stupid.
Yippeeeeeee, I'm feeling so bored :|

(side-tracking a bit)
As @johncmayer says:
Northwest Airlines is the Southwest Airlines of the north. So much funnier that way.
Ha ha ha! I just copied the entire size and font?? Awesome.

(back!)
Now, I found a cool livejournal layout to change to and use, but I'd have to download it and it might take some time. And since I'm in quite a hurry as I have not showered yet and it's almost 10pm, and there's school early tomorrow morning.... I shall put the URL of the download up here so I can download it any time I'm free, next time. Whew, that was a long, long sentence!!
http://community.livejournal.com/jadedpaper/52864.html


Okay, I have to shower now. My mom is practically barking.
- - - - - - - - - -

[ mood | chipper ]

yep, i know i haven't posted in my LJ for soooo long. but here, i'm finally here! i'm seriously bad at LiveJournal. i don't know how to work the fake cut stuff and the customized layout stuff... boo hoo. it's been really long and i'm just updating to keep this Journal alive. I'm sorry I can't be more active here. Gotta go.

Hello to everyone and the LJ world over there.
Am very proud to join livejournal and super super excited to make loads of LJ friends (if that's how to call 'em)!!
Hopefully I'll be consistent with this.
Ha ha ha, you can very well tell from that line that I ain't a very consistent person, most of the time. And that's not wrong!
I lead a very ordinary life, and although I often find it beautiful and love to share about it, I do it in my mind. I'm also fond of writing them down by pencil, on paper. Ha ha ha, I love talking in my mind as if it is my world and I love writing by pencils on paper! 
Either way: This is my first entry.
